author: KurtPfeifle
body:
I'm experiencing this on a current *Debian Linux 'Stretch'* system:

* Starting PowerShell results in a "hang".
* Only after hitting *`ctrl+c`* the PS prompt appears.


Steps to reproduce
------------------

```none
mkdir ${HOME}/AppImages
cd ${HOME}/AppImages
wget -c https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.0.0-rc.2/powershell-6.0.0-rc.2-x86_64.AppImage
wget -c https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.0.0-rc/powershell-6.0.0-rc-x86_64.AppImage
wget -c https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.0.0-beta.9/powershell-6.0.0-beta.9-x86_64.AppImage
chmod +x powershell*AppImage
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Each of the RC1/RC2-AppImages should work at least as well as the Beta9 AppImage.

How well the Beta9 worked, you can also observe in my ASCIInema demo here:

[![asciicast](https://asciinema.org/a/145735.png)](https://asciinema.org/a/145735)

## Actual behavior

### Beta9 AppImage starts instantly

```none
kp@stretch:AppImages> ./powershell-6.0.0-beta.9-x86_64.AppImage 
PowerShell v6.0.0-beta.9
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS /home/kp/AppImages> $PSVersionTable.PSVersion                                                                                                                                                                                              
Major Minor Patch Label 
----- ----- ----- ----- 
    6     0     0 beta.9

PS /home/kp/AppImages> exit
```

### RC(1) AppImage "hangs"; needs `crtl+c` to start

```none
kp@stretch:AppImages> ./powershell-6.0.0-rc-x86_64.AppImage                                                                                                                                                                               
^CPowerShell v6.0.0-rc
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/kp/AppImages> $PSVersionTable.PSVersion                                                                                                                                                                                              
Major  Minor  Patch  PreReleas BuildLabel 
                     eLabel               
-----  -----  -----  --------- ---------- 
6      0      0      rc

PS /home/kp/AppImages> exit
```

**Notice the *`^C`* in the second line above! I hit *`ctrl+c`* after about 60 seconds of "hanging".**

### RC2 AppImage "hangs"; needs `crtl+c` to start

```none
kp@stretch:AppImages> ./powershell-6.0.0-rc.2-x86_64.AppImage 
^CPowerShell v6.0.0-rc.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/kp/AppImages> $PSVersionTable.PSVersion                                                                                                                                                                                              
Major  Minor  Patch  PreReleas BuildLabel 
                     eLabel               
-----  -----  -----  --------- ---------- 
6      0      0      rc.2                 

PS /home/kp/AppImages>
```

**Notice the *`^C`* in the second line above! I hit *`ctrl+c`* after about 30 seconds of "hanging".**


Environment data
----------------

```bash
kp@stretch:AppImages> cat /etc/os-release 
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="9"
VERSION="9 (stretch)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"

kp@stretch:AppImages> cat /etc/debian_version 
9.3

kp@stretch:AppImages> uname -a
Linux lenjessie2 4.9.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.65-3 (2017-12-03) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

comments.author: KurtPfeifle
comments.body:
Wrong alarm! Nevermind...

The cause of the "hang" is now found:

1. I was running the PowerShell session via SSH to my Debian box in the next room.
2. The SSH session was not using a *`-X`* or `-Y` flag.
3. The first start of both new versions triggered a dialog asking me if I wanted "desktop integration" of the PowerShell AppImage.
4. Since this Debian box did not have a monitor attached nor the SSH X-forwarding enabled, I never saw the dialog, which is a modal one.
5. Hitting *`ctrl+c`* obviously killed that dialog and gave way to powershell's final startup.

title: [Regression] AppImage for Beta9 worked; AppImages for RC1 and RC2 don't
